page.title: 20WORSHIP IN SKIPSEA
page.content: Skipsea has an Anglican Church and a Methodist Chapel. The Church stands high at the West end of the village close to Castle Hill. It was first built in 1196,then on an artificial mound, probably from sea cobbles which had been taken from the nearby castle which was demolished in 1220.The style is Early English, with a chancel nave, side aisles and tower. It holds 250 but the present congregation is about 20, plus a Sunday School of 12 run by Miss Ulliott. The vicar is Rev.John Simson.The Wesleyan methodist chapel was built in 1910 on the site of the original built in 1848. It holds 90 & has a regular congregation is about 20. There used to be a Congregational Church built in 1801 but this has gone now.There was also a strong Quaker group in the C18th.Where they met is still called Quaker House.
